abstracts.cdata!:
Financial management capacity building
            (FMCB) initiative supported the government’s efforts to
            enhance its institutional capacity in guiding the
            implementation of its structural reform program in selected
            sectors such as banking and finance, public financial
            management, and state-owned enterprises (SOEs).
            International Development Association (IDA) financing and
            Bank expertise have supported Lao reform efforts to enhance
            fiscal transparency by supporting publishing of audit
            reports and budget reports, eliminate arrears on salaries by
            installing an electronic salary payment system, improve
            management of SOEs by designing restructuring plans and
            conducting financial audits, and improve fiduciary controls
            by supporting establishment of the centralized national
            treasury. In order to continue supporting the Government of
            Lao People's Democratic Republic (PDR) in
            implementation of the public finance management
            strengthening program and supporting institutions for
            external accountability, the Bank is preparing a follow-up
            public finance management project, building on the lessons
            learned from the FMCB project.
